# Academic and Professional Interests

::: {.content-visible when-profile="es"}

Además de mis habilidades profesionales, mi carrera me ha llevado a explorar diversas áreas de conocimiento que han dejado una huella en mi visión del mundo. A continuación, describo algunas áreas que han cautivado particularmente mi atención:
:::

#### Teoría de la Complejidad y Teoría de la Información

::: justified
🧩 Explorando la complejidad de los fenómenos. 📚 [Formaciones](https://www.youtube.com/@redcompleja4990) y entusiasmo por propiedades emergentes, entropía [@ben-naim2008], la obra revolucionaria de Claude Shannon [-@shannon1949] y estudios posteriores en diversas áreas de conocimiento [e.g., @boisot2004; @gleick2011; @snowden2002; @polyanskiy2022].
:::

#### Teoría de grafos y análisis de redes

::: justified
🌐 Desentrañando las relaciones más allá de los actores. 🔗 Representar la compejidad como sistemas interconectados e interdependientes, considerando tanto los nodos como los vínculos que los unen [@börner2007; @granovetter1973; @granovetter1983; @newman2018].
:::

#### Economía, instituciones y cultura

::: justified
💼 Explorando las bases socio-culturales del comportamiento económico. 📖 Investigación interdisciplinaria sobre cómo la cultura y las instituciones influyen en la gestión de los recursos, la información y el conocimiento. En este caso la lista de referencias es demasiado extensa pero, por fuera de la economía pura y dura, vale la pena mencionar los trabajos en sistemas de innovación [@cooke2001; @etzkowitz2000; @lundvall1988; @nelson1993], innovación abierta [@chesbrough2003; @vonhippel2005], commons [@allen2016; @hess2007; @kostakis2015; @ostrom1990], economía de la información [@boisot1998].
:::

#### Teoría de las Organizaciones y Gestión del Conocimiento

::: justified
🏘️ Estudiando estrategias para la producción colectiva de conocimiento 📦 Es otro campo en el que la abundancia de bibliografía es notable. Más allá de incontables referencias clásicas [e.g., @alavi2001; @cetina1999; @march1991; @nonaka1995; @polanyi1958; @teece1997], destaco el marco teórico desarrollado por Boisot [-@boisot1995] para entender flujos de información y conocimiento en entornos sociales: el *Information Space* o *I-Space*. Codificación, abstracción y difusión son tres dimensiones clave que sirven para analizar la continua producción de conocimiento [@boisot2011].
:::

#### Plataformas y digitalización

::: justified
🗂️ Navegando la Era Digital. 📊 Explorando el fenómeno de las plataformas y su impacto generalizado en la economía contemporánea. Me atraen particularmente las perspectivas teóricas como Gawer [-@gawer2020]. Es fundamental entender cómo estas plataformas están remodelando las interacciones económicas y sociales. Escribimos [algo sobre el tema](https://comein.uoc.edu/divulgacio/oikonomics/_recursos/documents/14/canals-hulskamp_Oikonomics14_esp.pdf).
:::

#### Filosofía: Pragmatismo, enactivismo, educación, psicología

::: justified
🧠 Filosofía en acción. 📜 Exploración de enfoques pragmatistas [@dewey1923], enactivistas [@varela2017] y su aplicación en campos como la educación y la psicología [e.g., @bereiter2014; @kress2009; @scardamalia2010].
:::

#### Zettelkasten

::: justified
🗂️ Organización creativa. 🤯 La [técnica del Zettelkasten](https://docs.zettlr.com/en/advanced/zkn-method/) como motor de generación de ideas y organización de pensamientos [@ahrens2022].
:::

#### Idiomas

::: justified
🗣️ Conectando a través del lenguaje. 🌎 Mi pasión por comprender diferencias culturales y patrones de comunicación me ha llevado indefectiblemente a aprender idiomas. Además de mi fluidez en español, inglés, italiano y catalán (aún lo estudio activamente), puedo comunicarme en francés. Me encantaría poder seguir aprendiendo otras lenguas.
:::
:::

::: {.content-visible when-profile="en"}
::: justified
In addition to my professional skills, my career has led me to explore various areas of knowledge that have left a mark on my worldview. Here, I describe some areas that have particularly captured my attention, including some references to my own work:
:::

### Academia-Industry Collaboration (AIC)
::: justified 
Building bridges to increase the impact of ideas 🎓🤝 💼 

The transfer of knowledge between academic and business organizations to promote innovation is the main subject I have been working on for the last 5 or 6 years. So far it has been a process which involved navigating multiple perspectives, continuously increasing in its complexity:

* My interest in the subject appeared thanks to the Economics of Knowledge course of my Master's, where a collegue and I explored the role of public research institutions in catching-up processes by analyzing the the case of India.

* The exploration of the subject continued with my Master's thesis, titled "University-Industry Relationship through Knowledge Transfer Organizations in Developing Countries: Evidence from an Argentinian Local Innovation Ecosystem"

* The recent submission of PhD Thesis, titled "Understanding Knowledge Dynamics Across Modes of Academia-Industry Collaboration:
A Comprehensive Mixed-Method Analysis within the I-Space Framework: Lessons from San Carlos de Bariloche, Argentina", represent the last and most profound stage of this process.

:::

### Knowledge Management and Organizational Learning
::: justified
🏘️ Designing strategies for the collective production of knowledge 📦

A critical topic I studied for my doctorate and which motivates me to approach the implementation of knowledge. 

* Since I have not contributed much to the field so far, I should highlight the theoretical framework developed by Boisot [-@boisot1995] for understanding information and knowledge flows in social settings: the *Information Space* or *I-Space*. In my [**blog**](blog.qmd), I am now trying to synthesize and use this framework to analyze the conjuncture.

* Coding, abstraction, and diffusion are three key dimensions used to analyze the ongoing production of knowledge [@boisot2011].

* Besides the I-Space, other perspectives have also shaped my understanding of the field [e.g., @alavi2001; @cetina1999; @march1991; @nonaka1995; @polanyi1958; @teece1997].
:::

### Economics, Institutions, and Culture
::: justified
💼 Exploring the socio-cultural foundations of economic and human behavior 📖 

How culture and institutional arrangements define the management of resources, information, and knowledge? 

* Besides exploring Academia-Industry Collaborations, with another classmate of the master we made an analysis of hackerspace and makerspaces based on Ostrom's [-@ostrom1990] idea of commons.

* Beyond my limited contribution to the subject, a few approaches worth mentioning are innovation systems [@cooke2001; @etzkowitz2000; @lundvall1988; @nelson1993], open innovation [@chesbrough2003; @vonhippel2005], commons [@allen2016; @hess2007; @kostakis2015; @ostrom1990], and information economics [@boisot1998].

:::

### Platforms and Digitalization
::: justified
🗂️ Navigating the Digital Age 📊

The continuous proliferation of information and communication technologies (ICTs) has a strong impact on the production of knowledge and information.

* With my PhD supervisor we've broadly explored the [foundations of digital platforms and their classification](https://comein.uoc.edu/divulgacio/oikonomics/_recursos/documents/14/canals-hulskamp_Oikonomics14_esp.pdf).

* I'm particularly drawn to theoretical perspectives like Gawer [-@gawer2020]. I believe understanding how these platforms are reshaping economic and social interactions is fundamental. 
:::

### Graph Theory and Network Analysis
::: justified
🌐 Unraveling relationships beyond the actors🔗 

Representing complexity as interconnected and interdependent systems, considering both nodes and the links that connect them [@börner2007; @granovetter1973; @granovetter1983; @newman2018]. 

* I have worked with bibliometric databases and survey data to analyze collaboration processes among researchers and between academic and business stakeholders. [**Here**](visualMedia/hulskampPresentation.mp4) you can see my presentation "Scientific Collaboration through Institutional Networks: The Value of National Partners" at the [NetSci 2021](https://networks2021.net/) conference.

:::

### Philosophy: Pragmatism, Enactivism, Education, Psychology
::: justified
🧠 Philosophy in action. 📜 

I have explored pragmatism and enactivists approaches [e.g., @dewey1923; @varela2017], as well as their application in fields like education and psychology [e.g., @bereiter2014; @kress2009; @scardamalia2010].

* As part of my undergraduate thesis and as a research fellow at CIECE, I researched how economic models typically fail to successfully represent complexity.  
:::

### Complexity Theory and Information Theory
::: justified
🧩 Exploring the complexity of phenomena. 📚

Enthusiasm for emergent properties, entropy [@ben-naim2008], the groundbreaking work of Claude Shannon [-@shannon1949], and subsequent studies in various knowledge areas [e.g., @boisot2004; @gleick2011; @snowden2002; @polyanskiy2022]. I recently participated in an interesting [course](https://www.youtube.com/@redcompleja4990) on complex networks.  
:::

The [Zettelkasten technique](https://docs.zettlr.com/en/advanced/zkn-method/) as a source of idea generation and thought organization [@ahrens2022].
